intro: Pseudomalmea boyacana, commonly known as the Boyacá pseudomalmea, is a flowering plant species native to the Andean regions of Colombia. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly known as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations ranging from 1,500 to 3,000 meters. Its botanical features include fleshy stems and leaves adapted to arid conditions, making it well-suited for its native habitat. It is a rare and endemic species, contributing to the biodiversity of the Andean flora.
